Node.definition: = action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= man; ◄ son of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) ► king of Judah (יְהוּדָה)
= town; ◄ territory of Ephraim (אֶפְרַיִם) ► assigned to clan of Kohath (קֳהָת) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) as a town of refuge
= town; ◄ territory of Ephraim (אֶפְרַיִם) ► assigned to clan of Kohath (קֳהָת) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) as a town of refuge

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= causative action by which humans or deities place (other) humans in a position of royal authority over a group of people

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= man; ◄ son of Nebath (נְבָט) ► former servant of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) who later became the first king of the northern kingdom of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ► father of king Jeroboam (יָרָבְעָם) king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation
= man; ◄ son of David (דָּוִד) tribe of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► king of Judah and Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) given the name Jedidiah (יְדִידְיָהּ) at his birth
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which animals, humans, or deities move back to a location where they have been before
= man; ◄ son of Nebath (נְבָט) ► former servant of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) who later became the first king of the northern kingdom of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
= causative action by which humans or deities send one or more people though the people sent are not mentioned explicitly to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities let (other) humans know that they are to come, either by approaching them directly or sending a message
= man; ◄ son of Nebath (נְבָט) ► former servant of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) who later became the first king of the northern kingdom of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= man; ◄ son of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) ► king of Judah (יְהוּדָה)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

Node.gloss: to harden (someone's) yoke > to force (someone) to work harder
Node.definition: literally: to harden someone's yoke; hence: = causative action by which humans increase the amount of labor imposed on other humans, ◄ which weighs down on them as a yoke

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= bar or frame ◄ normally made of wood ► used to join two draft animals at the neck so that they can work together effectively in pulling a plow, threshing board, harrow, or wagon; ≈ often used in a figurative sense to denote oppression
= a marker indicating that an important statement is following and demanding the attention of the listener
= causative action by which humans reduce the intensity of a situation
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort
literally: hard; hence: = state in which an event is associated with hardship and suffering

= bar or frame ◄ normally made of wood ► used to join two draft animals at the neck so that they can work together effectively in pulling a plow, threshing board, harrow, or wagon; ≈ often used in a figurative sense to denote oppression
= state in which an object has relatively much weight, ≈ which is often associated with slowness, functioning with difficulty, but also with importance, riches, status, etc.
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= state in which humans, either as individuals or as groups, are in a position of subservience towards (other) individuals or groups, which is normally accompanied by a number of duties, tasks and obligations

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which a countable entity is three in number

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which animals, humans, or deities move back to a location where they have been before
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= action by which humans come together to exercise their minds as a group to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= man; ◄ son of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) ► king of Judah (יְהוּדָה)
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus

= a council or a group of older men who act with authority on behalf of or over their people; some represent an entire nation, others manage the affairs at the town level; some provide their leader with counsel; involved in both judicial and military decisions, and participating in cultic ceremonies; ≈ expected to be wise and considered worthy of deference and respect
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= man; ◄ son of David (דָּוִד) tribe of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► king of Judah and Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) given the name Jedidiah (יְדִידְיָהּ) at his birth
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

= state in which humans and deities are alive and well, ◄ which, for humans, requires the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= referent to the way in which an event is performed; ► normally with the intention of finding out how, but often used in rhetorical questions in order to express one's conviction that that event in question cannot be performed at all (under the given circumstances)
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse
= action by which humans or deities give information to others to help them exercise their minds to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose

Node.gloss: to respond|to bring back word|to report
Node.definition: literally: to bring back word; hence: = action by which humans respond to (other) humans or deities in a direct conversation

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
literally: all the days; hence: = process by which an event or pattern of events takes place for an extended time, without interruption
= action by which humans or deities suspend their commitment to a certain pattern of behavior

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= action by which humans come together to exercise their minds as a group to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= posterity of humans and or animals of undetermined sex, at an age ranging from before birth to adulthood
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= process by which young humans or animals undergo the natural development of increasing in size and changing physically on their way to being fully grown
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

Node.gloss: to reign|to be king|to be queen|to become king|to become queen
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities are in a position of royal authority over a group of people
= man; ◄ son of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) ► king of Judah (יְהוּדָה)
= causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= man; ◄ son of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) ► king of Judah (יְהוּדָה)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= man, also called Adoram (אֲדֹרָם) and Adoniram (אֲדֹנִירָם) ◄ son of Abda (עַבְדָּא) ► official during time of David (דָּוִד) Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and Rehoboam (רְחַבְעָם) stoned by people during rebellion against Rehoboam (רְחַבְעָם)
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= a class of people who are enlisted compulsorily to do work for others
literally: to stone (with stones); hence: = causative action by which humans throw rocks at other humans until they die
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

= an object ◄ of stone, ► usually found in nature and used for throwing, building crude constructions; stones with a particular shape are sometimes used as a memorial or religious symbol; ≈ regarded as extremely common, easily available, but also as strong, hard, and unflexible
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= man; ◄ son of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) ► king of Judah (יְהוּדָה)
= process by which humans summon their physical strength to accomplish a particular goal

Node.gloss: to go up|to climb up|to mount
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals or objects go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot, carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle
= open vehicle with two or four wheels, pulled by one or more horses; ◄ made or wood and iron; ► used in war or for travelling
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= action by which a person or group challenges or defies an authority or agreement

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household
= man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
